tools.name: RunSomeTests
tools.title: Run Some Tests
tools.description: Runs specific tests using the active scheme's active test plan

tests.description: Array of test specifiers to run. Each specifier contains 'targetName' and 'testIdentifier' fields. Use GetTestList action to discover available tests and their identifiers, then extract the 'targetName' and 'identifier' fields from the TestActionInfo results to construct TestActionSpecifier objects.

results.description: Results for each test (truncated at 100, failures shown first)

totalResults.description: Total number of test results before truncation

truncated.description: Whether results were truncated due to exceeding 100 results

tools.name: XcodeMV
tools.title: Move File
tools.description: Moves or renames files and directories in the project navigator with support for filesystem operations.

destinationPath.description: Project navigator relative path for the destination (for move) or new name (for rename)

operation.description: The type of move operation to perform

overwriteExisting.description: Whether to overwrite existing files at the destination

sourcePath.description: Project navigator relative path of the source item to move/rename

destinationFinalPath.description: The final path of the moved/renamed item

sourceOriginalPath.description: The original path of the source item

tools.name: DocumentationSearch
tools.title: DocumentationSearch
tools.description: Searches Apple Developer Documentation using semantic matching.

frameworks.description: Framework(s) to search in. Searches all frameworks if not specified.

documents.description: The documents most relevant to the search query

score.description: The matching score of the document

tools.name: XcodeGlob
tools.title: Search Files
tools.description: Finds files in the Xcode project structure matching wildcard patterns. Works on Xcode project organization, not filesystem structure. Example patterns: '*.swift', '**/*.json', 'src/**/*.{swift,m}'. If no pattern is provided, defaults to '**/*' (all files).

path.description: Which project directory to search in (optional, defaults to root)

pattern.description: File matching pattern using wildcards (* ** ? [abc] {swift,m}). Examples: '*.swift', '**/*.json', 'src/**/*.{swift,m}'. Defaults to '**/*' if not provided.

matches.description: List of matching file paths in the project structure (truncated at 100), sorted by most recently modified first

message.description: Optional message with additional information about the search results

pattern.description: The pattern that was searched for

searchPath.description: The project path that was searched

totalFound.description: Total number of files found before truncation

truncated.description: Whether results were truncated due to exceeding 100 files

tools.name: XcodeWrite
tools.title: Write File
tools.description: Creates or overwrites files with content in the Xcode project. Works on Xcode project structure paths, not filesystem paths. Automatically adds new files to the project structure. Both filePath and content parameters are required.

content.description: REQUIRED: The content to write to the file

filePath.description: REQUIRED: The path to the file within the Xcode project organization (e.g., 'ProjectName/Sources/MyFile.swift')

absolutePath.description: The absolute file system path of the written file

bytesWritten.description: Number of bytes written to the file

filePath.description: The project path that was written

linesWritten.description: Number of lines written to the file

message.description: Result message describing the write operation

success.description: Whether the file write operation succeeded

wasExistingFile.description: Whether the file existed before writing

tools.name: XcodeListWindows
tools.title: List Windows
tools.description: Lists the current Xcode windows and their workspace information

message.description: Description of all open Xcode windows

tools.name: XcodeUpdate
tools.title: Edit File
tools.description: Edits files in the Xcode project by replacing text content. Works on Xcode project structure paths, not filesystem paths. IMPORTANT: The tool will fail if filePath, oldString, or newString parameters are missing.

filePath.description: REQUIRED: The path to the file to modify within the Xcode project organization (e.g., 'ProjectName/Sources/MyFile.swift')

newString.description: REQUIRED: The text to replace it with, must be different from oldString

replaceAll.description: Replace all occurrences of oldString (default false)

editsApplied.description: Number of successful text replacements made

filePath.description: The path of the file that was edited

message.description: Optional message with additional information about the edit results

modifiedContentLength.description: Length of the file content after editing

originalContentLength.description: Length of the file content before editing

success.description: Whether the edit operation completed successfully

tools.name: RunAllTests
tools.title: Run All Tests
tools.description: Runs all tests from the active scheme's active test plan

results.description: Results for each test (truncated at 100, failures shown first)

totalResults.description: Total number of test results before truncation

truncated.description: Whether results were truncated due to exceeding 100 results

tools.name: XcodeListNavigatorIssues
tools.title: List Workspace Issues
tools.description: Lists the currently known issues shown Xcode's Issue Navigator UI in the workspace. These issues include those that have been discovered since the last build, and also issues like package resolution problems and workspace configuration issues. You can filter the issues to include by file name, glob, or severity. Use this tool when you want to list all the users the user can see in the workspace UI.

glob.description: Glob to filter the returned issues. Will match against the 'path' field.

pattern.description: Regex to filter the returned issues. Will match against the 'message' field.

severity.description: Limit the returned issues to those that have the specified severity or higher. Valid values in order of decreasing severity are 'error', 'warning', 'remark'. Defaults to 'error'.

issues.description: The list of current issues matching the input filters

category.description: The category of the issue, if known

line.description: The line number where the issue was detected, if known

path.description: The file path where the issue was detected, if any

severity.description: The severity of issue (error, warning, remark)

vitality.description: Whether an issue from a previous build is known to still be relevant or whether something might have changed since it was emitted (for example if the source file has been edited and it isn't yet known whether that edit fixes the issue). Possible values: (fresh, stale)

message.description: Optional message with additional information about the search results

totalFound.description: Total number of issues before truncation

truncated.description: Whether results were truncated due to exceeding 100 issues

tools.name: XcodeGrep
tools.title: Search Content
tools.description: Searches for text patterns in files within the Xcode project structure using regex. Works on Xcode project organization, not filesystem structure. CRITICAL: Must include a 'pattern' argument - this tool will fail without it.

glob.description: Only search files matching this pattern

linesAfter.description: Show N lines after each match for context

linesBefore.description: Show N lines before each match for context

linesContext.description: Show N lines both before and after each match

multiline.description: Allow patterns to span multiple lines

outputMode.description: What to return: content, files_with_matches, or count (default: files_with_matches)

path.description: Where to search - file or directory in project (defaults to root)

pattern.description: Text to search for using regex. REQUIRED: Must include a 'pattern' argument - this tool will fail without it.

showLineNumbers.description: Show line numbers with results (content mode only)

type.description: Shortcut for common file types (swift, js, py, etc.)

message.description: Additional information about the search results

pattern.description: The pattern that was searched for

results.description: Search results based on output mode

searchPath.description: The project path that was searched

truncated.description: Whether results were truncated due to limits

tools.name: RenderPreview
tools.title: RenderPreview
tools.description: Builds and renders a Preview and waits until a snapshot of the resulting UI is available.

previewDefinitionIndexInFile.description: The zero based index of the #Preview macro or PreviewProvider struct definition in the source file counting from the top. Defaults to 0, i.e. the first one.

sourceFilePath.description: The path to the file within the Xcode project organization (e.g., 'ProjectName/Sources/MyFile.swift')

timeout.description: The time in seconds to wait for the rendering of the preview to complete. Defaults to 120 seconds.

error.description: An error that occurred during the preview attempt.

message.description: The error message with potential underlying errors included.

previewSnapshotPath.description: The path to the image snapshot of the requested preview.

tools.name: XcodeRead
tools.title: Read
tools.description: Reads the contents of a file within the Xcode project organization. Returns content in cat -n format with line numbers. Supports reading up to 600 lines by default with optional offset and limit parameters for large files.

filePath.description: The path to the file within the Xcode project organization (e.g., 'ProjectName/Sources/MyFile.swift')

limit.description: The number of lines to read (only provide if the file is too large to read at once)

offset.description: The line number to start reading from (only provide if the file is too large to read at once)

content.description: The file contents formatted with line numbers (cat -n style)

filePath.description: The project path that was read

fileSize.description: Size of the file in bytes

startLine.description: The line number where reading started

totalLines.description: Total number of lines in the file

tools.name: XcodeRM
tools.title: Remove File
tools.description: Removes files and directories from the Xcode project structure and optionally deletes the underlying files from the filesystem.

deleteFiles.description: Also move the underlying files to Trash (defaults to true)

recursive.description: Remove directories and their contents recursively

message.description: Status message about the removal operation

removedPath.description: The project path that was removed

success.description: Whether the removal operation was successful

tools.name: XcodeMakeDir
tools.title: Create Directory
tools.description: Creates directories and groups in the Xcode project structure.

directoryPath.description: Project navigator relative path for the directory to create

createdPath.description: The path of the created directory

tools.name: XcodeLS
tools.title: List Directory Contents
tools.description: Lists files and directories in the Xcode project structure at the specified path. Works on Xcode project organization, not filesystem structure.

recursive.description: Recursively list all files (truncated to 100 lines). Default: true

items.description: List of files and directories at the specified path

path.description: The resolved project path that was browsed

tools.name: XcodeRefreshCodeIssuesInFile
tools.title: XcodeRefreshCodeIssuesInFile
tools.description: Retrieves current compiler diagnostics (errors, warnings, notes) for a file in the Xcode project. Returns formatted diagnostic information including severity levels and messages.

filePath.description: The path to the file within the Xcode project organization (e.g., 'ProjectName/Sources/MyFile.swift')

content.description: Formatted diagnostic output with severity levels and messages

diagnosticsCount.description: Number of diagnostics found (errors, warnings, notes)

filePath.description: The project path that was checked for diagnostics

success.description: Whether the diagnostic retrieval completed successfully

tools.name: GetTestList
tools.title: Get Test List
tools.description: Gets all available tests from the active scheme's active test plan

isEnabled.description: Whether the test is enabled in the test plan

tools.name: BuildProject
tools.title: Build Project
tools.description: Builds an Xcode project and waits until the build completes.

buildResult.description: The message indicating the result of the build operation

elapsedTime.description: The time it took to finish the build, in seconds

classification.description: The type of error (error, warning, etc.)

filePath.description: The file path where the error occurred

lineNumber.description: The line number where the error occurred

tools.name: GetBuildLog
tools.title: Get Build Log
tools.description: Gets the log of the current or most recently finished build. You can choose which build log entries to include by specifying the severity of any issues emitted by the build task represented by the entry. You can also filter by message regex pattern or file glob pattern. The response also indicates whether the build is currently in progress.

glob.description: Glob to filter the returned build log entries. Will match against the 'path' field of any emitted issues, as well as against the location of any build task.

pattern.description: Regex to filter the returned build log entries. Will match against the 'message' field of any emitted issues, as well as the task description, command line, and console output of any build tasks.

severity.description: Limit the output of build log entries to those that emitted issues of the specified severity or higher. Valid values in order of decreasing severity are 'error', 'warning', 'remark'. Defaults to 'error'.

buildIsRunning.description: Indicates whether the build is still running.

buildLogEntries.description: The build log entries describing build commands that emitted issues

buildTask.description: The build task represented by the log entry

emittedIssues.description: Any issues emitted by the build task represented by the log entry

line.description: The line number where the issue was detected, if known

path.description: The file path where the issue was detected, if any

severity.description: The severity of issue (error, warning, remark)

buildResult.description: The message indicating the result of the build operation

fullLogPath.description: Path of the full log in textual format, containing the complete command lines and any output from the build tasks

message.description: Optional message with additional information about the search results

totalFound.description: Total number of build log entries before truncation

truncated.description: Whether results were truncated due to exceeding 100 issues

tools.name: ExecuteSnippet
tools.title: ExecuteSnippet
tools.description: Builds and runs a snippet of code in the context of a specific file and waits until results are available. This tool is available for source files in targets that build applications, frameworks, libraries, or command line executables. The output consists of the console output generated by the `print` statements contained in the provided snippet.

codeSnippet.description: The code snippet that should be executed in the context of the specified file.

sourceFilePath.description: The path to a Swift source file within the Xcode project organization (e.g., 'ProjectName/Sources/MyFile.swift') whose context the code snippet will have access to (including `fileprivate` declarations).

timeout.description: The time in seconds to wait for the execution of the snippet to complete. Defaults to 120 seconds.

error.description: An error that occurred during the snippet execution attempt.

message.description: The error message with potential underlying errors included.

executionResults.description: The console output generated by the `print` statements contained in the provided snippet.
